Description: The high-level goal and purpose of the product are established. Key stakeholders define what success looks like.
Result: A clear Project Vision Statement and business case.

Description: A strategic, high-level plan that outlines the likely sequence of major features or product capabilities over time.
The Product Owner, with input from stakeholders, creates a comprehensive, ordered list of everything that might be needed in the product.
The team regularly reviews the Product Backlog to add detail, estimates, and order to the items. This is not a formal event but an ongoing activity.
Result: A refined, estimated, and well-understood Product Backlog for future Sprints.

Description: The entire Scrum team collaborates to define a Sprint Goal and select items from the Product Backlog to work on during the upcoming Sprint.
Result: A Sprint Goal and a Sprint Backlog.

Description: A fixed-length timebox (typically 1-4 weeks) during which the Development Team works to create a 'Done', usable, and potentially releasable product Increment.
A short, 15-minute daily meeting for the Development Team to synchronize activities and create a plan for the next 24 hours.
Result: Team alignment, transparency, and identification of impediments.

Description: A development practice where developers merge their code changes into a central repository frequently, after which automated builds and tests are run.
Result: A consistently stable and integrated main codebase.

Description: The Scrum Team and stakeholders inspect the Increment from the Sprint. The Development Team demonstrates the work that it has 'Done'.
Result: Feedback from stakeholders, which may lead to an updated Product Backlog.

Description: An internal team meeting to reflect on the past Sprint, discussing what went well, what could be improved, and how to make changes for the next Sprint.
Interval: Once per Sprint (after Review, before next Planning)
Result: A list of actionable process improvements for the team.

Description: The sum of all the Product Backlog items completed during a Sprint and the value of the increments of all previous Sprints. It must be in a usable condition.
Interval: At the end of every Sprint
Result: A 'Done', usable, and potentially shippable product Increment.

Description: A decision-making process for determining when to release one or more 'Done' Increments to the end-users. This is a business decision, not a mandatory part of every Sprint.
Result: A scheduled release date and plan.

Description: An automated process that takes the 'Done' Increment, runs it through further testing in a production-like environment, and deploys it to production.
Result: A rapid, reliable, and automated release of the software to users.

Description: The act of making the new version of the software available to customers.
Interval: On decision, following successful CD pipeline
Result: Live software in the hands of users.

Description: Gathering feedback, analytics, and insights from users interacting with the live product to inform future development.
Result: New ideas, bug reports, and feature requests to be added to the Product Backlog.
